title: Australian wine brand Penfolds logo script
content:
Anybody know if this Penfolds logo (an Australian wine brand) is hand drawn or is there any digitised font like it.  
Also, if anyone knows who designed it I'd be interested to know.  
Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [penfolds.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130302230019/http:/typophile.com/files/penfolds.jpg) | 6.9 KB |
author: Dominic Forde

comments.content: [This Penfolds Grange Hermitage label](http://web.archive.org/web/20130302230019/http:/nationaltreasures.nla.gov.au/index/Treasures/item/nla.int-ex8-s33/nla.int-ex8-s38) from the National Library of Australia shows a Penfolds label from 1967 with the same script, so I guess it's originally hand-drawn. Whether it's since been digitised, I'm afraid I don't know.
Thanks apostropher that's a handy site.

I love that font too! anybody know of any comparable fonts? or one like Kiehls?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130302230019im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LOGO_5752.gif)

Kyle, it would be best to start a new thread for Kiehl's.

As for the Penfolds lettering, I suggest P22's [Brass Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130302230019/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=IHT0000254) as having a similar contrasty feeling, although the initials are less fancy. You might also look at Letterhead Font's [Ephemera](http://web.archive.org/web/20130302230019/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/ephemera.php), for something more ornate.

- Mike Yanega
